intro: Alyxia dolioliflora, commonly known as the clustered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweed and other toxic plants. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a waxy texture. Alyxia dolioliflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
